Puppy Chow

Jump to Recipe

Puppy Chow, also known as Muddy Buddies, is a delightful no-bake treat that has captured the hearts of snack lovers everywhere. This easy-to-make dessert combines the crunch of Chex cereal with a rich blend of chocolate and peanut butter, then gets a sugary twist with a coating of powdered sugar. Perfect for parties, movie nights, or just a tasty afternoon snack, Puppy Chow is not only delicious but also incredibly versatile. You can customize it by adding your favorite mix-ins, such as nuts, pretzels, or even seasonal sprinkles. In this article, we will guide you through a simple and quick recipe to whip up your own Puppy Chow that is sure to impress your family and friends. Get ready to indulge in this sweet, crunchy snack that will have everyone coming back for more!

Ingredients

chex cereal

You can use any variety of Chex cereal, such as Rice, Corn, or Wheat, based on your preference. For a gluten-free option, choose Rice Chex. If you don't have Chex, you can substitute with similar cereals like Crispix or even popcorn for a different texture.

chocolate chips

Use semi-sweet chocolate chips for a classic taste, but you can also experiment with milk chocolate, dark chocolate, or even white chocolate for different flavor profiles. If you're looking for a healthier option, try using chocolate bars that you chop into pieces or sugar-free chocolate chips.

peanut butter

Creamy peanut butter is recommended for a smooth coating, but crunchy peanut butter can add texture. If you have nut allergies, you can substitute with sunflower seed butter or almond butter. For a twist, try flavored peanut butter, such as chocolate or honey.

powdered sugar

Powdered sugar is essential for the final coating, but if you don't have it, you can make your own by blending regular granulated sugar until fine. For a healthier alternative, you can use coconut sugar or a sugar substitute, though it might alter the flavor slightly.

vanilla extract

Vanilla extract enhances the overall flavor, but if you don't have any, you can substitute with almond extract for a different taste or omit it entirely if necessary. For a natural option, scrape the seeds from a vanilla bean pod, which will give a more intense flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine Chocolate Chips and Peanut Butter

    In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine 1 cup of chocolate chips and 1 cup of peanut butter. Make sure to use a bowl that is large enough to accommodate the mixture expanding as it melts.

  • Step 2: Melt the Mixture

    Microwave the bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring in between each interval. This prevents the chocolate from burning. Continue until the mixture is melted and smooth, which usually takes about 1-2 minutes.

  • Step 3: Add Vanilla Extract

    Once the chocolate and peanut butter are melted and combined, stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract for added flavor. Mix thoroughly.

  • Step 4: Coat the Chex Cereal

    In a large bowl, add 9 cups of Chex cereal. Pour the melted chocolate-peanut butter mixture over the cereal. Use a spatula to gently stir and coat the cereal evenly without breaking it.

  • Step 5: Shake with Powdered Sugar

    Transfer the coated cereal into a large resealable bag. Add 1 1/2 cups of powdered sugar, seal the bag tightly, and shake vigorously until all the cereal is well coated.

  • Step 6: Cool Before Serving

    Spread the Puppy Chow mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Allow it to cool completely before serving to let the chocolate set.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Puppy Chow and how is it different from dog food?

Puppy Chow is a sweet snack mix made from Chex cereal, chocolate, peanut butter, and powdered sugar. It's a treat for humans, not dogs, despite its name!

How do I measure out 9 cups of Chex cereal accurately?

Use a dry measuring cup for accuracy. Scoop the cereal into the cup without packing it down, then level it off with a straight edge for precise measurement.

Can I substitute other cereals for Chex?

Yes, you can use other cereals like Rice Krispies or Corn Chex, but the texture and taste may vary slightly. Chex provides a great crunch!

How do I melt chocolate chips and peanut butter safely in the microwave?

Start with 30-second intervals to prevent burning. Stir after each interval until melted and smooth. If it’s not melting well, continue in shorter bursts and stir more frequently.

What can I use instead of vanilla extract?

If you don't have vanilla extract, you can use almond extract for a different flavor or simply omit it. The recipe will still taste delicious!

How do I know when the Puppy Chow is well-coated with the chocolate mixture?

The Chex cereal should look shiny and evenly coated without any dry patches. Stir gently to ensure all pieces are coated without breaking them.

What is the best way to shake the Puppy Chow with powdered sugar?

Use a large resealable bag to contain the mixture. Once sealed, shake it vigorously but gently to coat the cereal evenly without spilling.

How long does Puppy Chow need to cool before serving?

Allow it to cool for about 10-15 minutes on the baking sheet. This helps the coating set and makes it easier to eat!

Can I store leftover Puppy Chow, and how?

Yes! Store Puppy Chow in an airtight container at room temperature for up to two weeks. It stays crunchy and delicious!

Is Puppy Chow safe for kids?

Yes, Puppy Chow is a fun and safe treat for kids, but be mindful of allergies to chocolate or peanut butter. Always supervise young children while eating.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free option, ensure that the Chex cereal used is labeled gluten-free. To make it vegan, substitute the chocolate chips with dairy-free chocolate and use a natural peanut butter without added sugars. Additionally, for nut-free variations, you can replace peanut butter with sunflower seed butter. Always check labels to accommodate any allergies.

Pairings

Puppy Chow pairs wonderfully with a variety of beverages such as cold milk, coffee, or hot chocolate. For a festive twist, try serving it alongside a sweet dessert wine or a creamy liqueur like Baileys. For additional snacking options, consider pairing it with fresh fruit like strawberries or bananas, which balance the sweetness and add a refreshing touch.

Serving Suggestions

Serve Puppy Chow in small cups or bowls for easy snacking, especially at parties or gatherings. For a creative twist, present it in a mason jar tied with a ribbon for a charming gift. You can also sprinkle some extra chocolate chips or crushed nuts on top for added texture and flavor. For themed occasions like movie nights or birthday parties, consider placing it in a popcorn bucket to enhance the fun vibe.

Puppy Chow

$5

Difficulty: 10%

Description

A sweet and crunchy snack mix that's perfect for satisfying your sweet tooth!

Ingredients

  • chex cereal: 9 cups
  • chocolate chips: 1 cup
  • peanut butter: 1 cup
  • powdered sugar: 1 1/2 cups
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
